definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I work at a govenment office.
The government hopes to curtail public spending in the next tax year.
sentences.chinese: 政府希望在下个财税年度减少公家开支。

sentences.english: However, many Swiss committee suicide by using such guns;
sentences.chinese: 不过，很多瑞士人就用当兵时公家发的枪枝自杀。

sentences.english: Zhaozhuren really is not taken public money and heartache.
sentences.chinese: 赵主任果然是拿了公家的钱不心疼。

sentences.english: All the government shoes are made of alligator hide.
sentences.chinese: 公家的鞋都是鳄鱼皮做的。

sentences.english: They are employed by architectural firms, private corporations and governments, or they may be self-employed.
sentences.chinese: 他们受雇于修建公司，公家企业，政府机构或许自雇。

sentences.english: Under the new regulations, a third of government cars have been mothballed.
sentences.chinese: 按照新规定，三分之一的公家车封存。

sentences.english: These are for my personal use.
sentences.chinese: 这些是我公家运用的东西。

sentences.english: This paper, published in Psychological Science in the Public Interest.
sentences.chinese: 这篇发布在公家好处报纸心理学栏目。

sentences.english: The adulteration of alcohol in the wine rouse public attention.
sentences.chinese: 在酒中掺杂酒精惹起了公家的留意。

sentences.english: He should never drink that much alcohol in public.
sentences.chinese: 他不该该在公家场合喝那末多酒。

sentences.english: You are monstrously audacious, how dare you misappropriate public funds?
sentences.chinese: 你真是狗胆包天，公家的钱也敢挪用？

definition: lit. to eat from government coffers/to serve as a government employee/to live off government money
to commandeer/to take over for the state
lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
sb with whom one is on familiar terms/sb from the same place (same house, same town etc)/one of us
